alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Floyd, eastern Carroll, and northern Patrick Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mabry Mill to near Meadows Of Dan to near Ararat. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall will cause ponding of water on roadways and may result in minor flooding in low-lying and normally flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Floyd... Woolwine... Laurel Fork... Meadows Of Dan... Buffalo Ridge... Mabry Mill... and Rocky Knob Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
